summary: This memo concerns Balmes HIDALGO, Jr., a covert employee of the Agency in the United States for training, and the Immigration and Naturalization Service's (INS) interest in contacting him regarding Communist activities. It discusses coordinating any INS contact with Staff C/ICB and WH, due to the sensitivity of HIDALGO's potential assignments, and suggests that INS submit questions through the Agency to avoid jeopardizing his future use. The memo also addresses a security breach by HIDALGO's father, who disclosed his Agency employment to an INS inspector.
title: HIDALGO, Balmes, Jr.
